courseDescription: An eLearning course covering key concepts in operating systems.

modules.title: Introduction to Memory Management
modules.description: Learn about the basics of memory management, including functions and address binding.
objectives: Understand the functions of memory management.
Learn about address binding and its different methods.
Grasp the concept of logical versus physical addresses.

images.alt: Diagram illustrating the functions of memory management

modules.title: Memory Allocation Techniques
modules.description: Explore different methods of memory allocation, including contiguous allocation, segmentation, and paging.
objectives: Understand the different memory allocation techniques.
Learn about contiguous memory allocation, segmentation, and paging.
Explore the advantages and disadvantages of each method.

modules.title: Virtual Memory and Demand Paging
modules.description: Understand the concept of virtual memory and how demand paging works.
objectives: Understand the concept of virtual memory.
Learn about demand paging and its benefits.
Explore the steps involved in handling a page fault.

images.alt: Diagram illustrating the steps in handling a page fault

modules.title: Page Replacement Algorithms
modules.description: Learn about various algorithms used for page replacement, such as FIFO, OPT, and LRU.
objectives: Understand the different page replacement algorithms.
Learn about FIFO, OPT, and LRU algorithms.
Explore the advantages and disadvantages of each algorithm.

modules.title: Deadlocks
modules.description: Explore the concept of deadlocks, including their causes, prevention, avoidance, detection, and recovery.
objectives: Learn about the necessary conditions for deadlocks.
Explore methods for handling deadlocks, including prevention, avoidance, detection, and recovery.
